attributes.action: Scottish Vote for Independance - DevoMax or Full Independance
attributes.additional_details:
On the 11th January 2011 David Cameron was quoted as saying "we have to respect the fact that Scotland voted for a separatist party."

With the way things are, slowly progressing towards "Devolution Max" anyway, should any question asked not be one of absolute independance or not, but wether Scotland should have a state of "DevoMax" or Full Independance.

It is clear to all, including David Cameron, that the Scottish people want more control over their country.  To offer an option of "No" to full indepence is shortsighted as the "seperatist" party will simply use that as clear evidence of the UK Government interefering in Scottish interests, and risks many rebelling against such a measure.

The question as it should be asked (or some variant of);

How should Scotland proceed in the 21st century?

With two options;

1. Devolution Max (or similar name)
2. Full Independance
